headline: Oven-Fried Pork Chops
description: Yummy oven-fried pork chops are dipped in egg and coated with an herby stuffing mix. Learn how long to bake pork chops with this quick and easy recipe.

video.description: See a simple, inexpensive way to make tender baked chops.
video.name: Oven-Fried Pork Chops

name: Oven-Fried Pork Chops
recipeIngredient: 1 cup herb-seasoned dry bread stuffing mix

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Pour butter into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Whisk together egg, milk, and pepper in a shallow dish. Place stuffing mix in a separate shallow dish. Dip pork chops in egg mixture, then coat with stuffing mix.
Lay pork chops in the prepared dish.

Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Flip chops and bake until no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, about 10 more minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: Fast and easy. My thin sliced pork chops turned out very tender. The chops were on sale this week. I didn't have bread stuffing but did use bread crumbs. Turned out good. Thanks for sharing recipe.

Before I realized I had saved this recipe I made them but I didn't use the egg and milk mixture. I prayed my chops with vegetable spray and coated them with the bread mixture and baked them for 20 minutes at 400 deg F. They were delicious and mouth-watering tender!

I have made this recipe for years, and still cannot find one better. I find that having extra butter when you turn them half way through will get them extra crunchy and tasty. Always use stuffing (I like the savory herb from stove top), and don't be afraid to beat it if you want the pieces smaller. Also, adding foil helps with cleanup afterwards (many of you already know this, but I thought I'd put it out there in case someone didn't). You can increase the temp the last five minutes if you like it extra crunchy. Hope this helps anyone who needs it☺️
I liked the seasoning but thought they were too dry.

Loved how fast and easy with just a few ingredients this recipe came together. It tasted great and since I don't like to fry food, it's a keeper for me. The only change I made was to grind upItalian flavored croutons because I didn't have any stuffing.
Loved it!
The pork bread stuffing mix has big pieces. I think next time I’ll pulverized the stuffing. I also used PAM on top. Tasted good

Easy to make. I can't fry a pork chop without it becoming show leather. I have now found my way to doing pork chops. Being late summer peach season is coming to a close so made a peach chutney. Wow what a great meal.

This recipe was delicious. I love pork chops but they dry out so easily, so I was very pleased with these results. I didn’t change a thing except I doubled the ingredients and made 8 chops. The coating was crispy and the inside juicy. I took other reviewer’s advice and used a metal pan. No sticking at all! Will definitely make again!

I make this every week. My wife says it’s the best pork chop yet. It is moist and flavorful each time. Thank you for sharing your recipe. I don’t think I will be searching for any substitution for pork chops.

I made this as directed with the exception of using plain breadcrumbs instead of stuffing. I used a glass pan and a nonstick metal pan. The metal pan chops came out far superior to the glass pan chops. I'll use this recipe from now on worth the metal pan. Perfection!

I loved this recipe. I rubbed my pork chops with lemon, garlic and barbeque spices. then covered with seltzer water overnight. I used bread crumbs and added onion powder, garlic powder, chili pepper and salt. Shook off the seltzer water and dipped into milk/egg mixture w/out pepper. then covered then chop in the bread crumb mixture. Used the butter and cooking method as instructed in the recipe. I checked the temp for 145 and removed. It was delicious served over buttered/cracked pepper rice. Everyone in my family loved it
Followed recipe exactly. Absolutely horrible results. Coating comes out soggy and sticking to the pan. Extra cooking only makes the meat dry and tough. Never again. Back to pan frying.
I did flip it a second time to get the coating to brown. Added about 3 minutes to do it. Absolutely loved the pork chops very tender!

Next time I make these, I will preheat the pan. The bread crumb coating would not crisp up, so it was mushy. Taste was ok & because I was trying to get the coating crisp up the pork chops were not tender.
This was sooooo good! I used Roasted Veggie Ritz Crackers, garlic powder, pepper and all the butter it called for. OMG OMG soo juicy and soo easy! Will be making this from now on!!
The flavor was just ok, but no way it only takes 20 minutes, more like 45
This turned out great. I had all the ingredients. Only thing I did different was I seasoned the pork chops with Slap Ya Mama seasoning, pepper, and garlic powder.
Simply delicious. I made it with scalloped potatoes

Pork chops were hard to eat (tuff). Following recipe:
@ 10 minutes - internal temp was only 120.
@ 40 minutes - internal temp 165,
but chops were not crisp & brown.
Broiled on 500 for 4 more minutes.
Nothing wrong with my stove, it's new.
Will not use recipe again.
No changes it was soooo good

I don't make pork chops much because they're hard to keep tender. I tend to over cook them. This recipe however was delicious! They came out great & tender. I didn't have stuffing mix, so I used Italian bread crumbs. Next time I will add some extra seasoning to the chops. Also some Parmesan & paprika to the bread crumbs. Can't wait to try again! Yum!

I followed the recipe exactly. I have a new oven, and it's right on, temperature-wise. I used bone in center cut chops, so cooked them an additional 5 minutes per side. The coating was a gummy mess, only the very edges of the chops got crunchy. The taste was great, the chops were perfectly cooked... but I wasn't a fan of that gummy coating.
Very yummy. Followed the directions to a t. Mine didn’t turnout could crispy at all. Next time I will put them in the air frier
My husband and I really enjoyed this simple and easy recipe. We didn't change a thing!! Thanks!
too bland
Easy and tasty. I didn’t change a thing and they were moist and flavorful. I did bake in my convection oven which I think makes them crispier. Same temp and time.
Loved this recipe, next time I may try and add more spice to the breading
Great recipe, easy to do. Tasted great.
Soggy breading at best with this recipe. Also, whatever breading is on the pork chops will stick to the pan.

I would have liked the breading a little bit more dry. Next time I'll try finishing off under the broiler.
I added a touch of Penzey's Italian seasoning to the seasoned bread crumbs. 
 Excellent flavor.
Followed the recipe, great.
Super yummy. The crumbs didn’t stick well to the egg/milk combo, so I light flour before that step next time and see how that works. Otherwise great
I followed the instructions exactly as written and they came out perfect. They were fork tender after 45 minutes in the oven. Anything this easy and tasty to make deserves 5 stars!

nice and moist chops. changes I made are italian breadcrumbs, used olive oil spray after turning them to make them more crispy and needed a extra 10 minutes to cook them. good easy recipe served with brown rice and frozen mixed veggies.

These were extremely moist inside and crisp outside. We didn’t like it only bc the pork itself is bland. I think we just prefer more marinated pork recipes. I did use the changes others provided: dipped in egg white and baked 20 minutes without turning. It’s an easy, quick dinner to be sure but I won’t be making them this way again. Thank you for sharing it!
Turned out very well, the only change I made was instead of regular milk, I used Almond milk.
Hands down, this is the best and easiest way to make pork chops. I don't modify the recipe at all other than using Tuscan seasoning instead of pepper. That's it!

The recipe was simple but very effective. The pork chops came out tender not dry.

Would try this again at a much higher serving.
Thank you for sharing
Daisy V from NYC
way too tough not tender at all for our liking. i think lower heat and longer cook time would be better for tenderness.
Made it with very thick bone in chops so they had to bake only a few min. longer and they were so juicy!!! I would not change a thing

Absolutely the best pork chops I have ever made! They were oh so tender and juicy! I used a large oven proof fry pan and did as another reviewer suggested, placing the butter in it and sticking it in the oven while preheating. I also added 2 additional tablespoons of butter. Ifloured the chops prior to dipping in egg mixture
They turned out wonderful. Not as crispy
It did not get crispy like I thought but taste was ok.

Easiest way to make pork chops...EVER! I used to cook mine in the skillet and they ended up being tough as leather. Made one change to the recipe - I used 1/2 Panko bread crumbs and half regular breadcrumbs. They come out tender and juicy!
Pork chops were amazing!
I used some of the information for this recipe but used a dip I use for my husband who is diabetic that calls for dry milk in place of flour.
These turned out pretty good. I did need to cook them an additional 6 minutes or so (4 boneless chops, roughly 1.4 lbs total).
Very good, no leftovers! Everyone loved it, even my picky 16-year-old son.

This is not a recipe I would make again. The cooking times were way off. Even though my pork chops were super thin (between 1/4" and 1/2" thin), it took more than 10 minutes per side; every time I took it out, it was still pink. I think I ended up cooking it more like 20-25 minutes per side because I kept having to put it back in the oven. When it was all said and done, I couldn't even eat it, as it tasted awful.
I made no changes and I will always make my boneless pork chops this way.Thanks again for the recipe!
love it
My family loves this recipe. I will definitely be making it again!
This was delicious and easy. We'll be repeating this for sure.

I’ve made this recipe at least half a dozen times; and it’s great; so easy to make, and hubby loves it, but it’s never crispy.
 How can I get it crispy?
I use herb-seasoned bread crumbs, instead of the 
 herb-seasoned dry bread bread stuffing mix. 
I’m not sure of what or where this mix would be. 
 All I can find are bread crumbs.

The best pork chops I have ever had. Easy to prepare for a big dinner with family & friends. I always use very thick chops, so I bake them a couple minutes more on each side to get the desired temperature for pork.
Quick, easy and delicious!

This recipe is great! The only thing Extra that I did was marinate my chops for 24 hours in zesty Italian salad dressing with some garlic powder. Then when I dipped them in the egg wash I left the salad dressing coating on them. It really adds flavor. Also used seasoned Italian breadcrumbs. Delicious!

Just egg dip,flour and mix of seasoned crumbs and panko 
They were juicy but not as good as fried. Healthier tho
Simple, quick and delicous

I made this for dinner last night and it was really good. I love that it is fast and easy. I didn't use butter or the stuffing mix but I did use bread crumbs and, I also used a rack . It works very well my pork chops was nice a crispy, even for lunch the next day. I did use my own season but thats how you make a good recipe into a even better one. In my opinion.

My son loves these. I hate how soggy the coating gets, so i plan to use a rack like another reviewer suggested. Sometimes i skip the egg mixture and just use mayonaise as the coating before the bread crumbs or stuffing mix. Either way its delicious.

Great recipe. I give it a few more minutes per side, but overall, excellent recipe. One of my go to's in a pinch. For a nice change, add a package of onion soup mix and some grated cheese to the coating.

Made this tonight and followed some of the other reviewers by coating the pork chops in flour first. I also added some garlic and onion powder. They were super simple and would make again, however I think I would take the advice of others on here who recommended Italian style breadcrumbs. Didn't love the stuffing mix. Also used thin sliced pork chops- definitely did not need 10 minutes per side. Did not turn out super dry, but not as tender as I had hoped. Would try again with the changes!
So easy and delicious! I used thick cut pork chops and cooked them 20 minutes on each side. My family, even my picky eater, loved them! I will make them again!
Can’t pin this recipe!
Recipe was easy and really good. Entire family like them. Shared recipe with others who also liked it. Definitely a keeper!
Wonderful easy way to make pork chops on a busy day- Simple to prepare put- in oven and go about your other tasks I also used seasoned breadcrumbs

I doubled the eggs and milk, to make sure I had enough to dip pork chops in. Pork chops took a little longer than 10 minutes on each side. When flipping over I used olive oil spray so coating wouldn't stick to pan. Coating could have been a little crisper. I would use less butter to coat pan or olive oil spray so coating will be crisper.
Excellent pork chops!! Great taste, tender and juicy inside and crunchy on the outside. My mom has a gluten sensitivity so I used gluten-free stuffing mix.

My husband said “3 stars—y’know, average,” and since I didn’t eat them, I’m going with that. I will say that the coating came off onto the bottom of the pan, which was disappointing, and the coating was not crunchy. I’ll keep looking for a good pork chop recipe.
My family really enjoyed these. The herb stuffing mix was a nice alternative to bread crumbs and added good flavor. The higher temperature, shorter cooking time helped preserve the juiciness as well.
Super yummy! I didn’t use milk & used Italian bread crumbs. Absolutely AMAZING. I broiled 5 minutes at the end.
My man didn’t like the bread crumbs
Yummy! Recipe is a keeper. Didn’t have milk on hand so used just egg and it turned out great. Super simple. Will definitely be making again.
So good!

Good and so easy to make. I rubbed seasoned salt and pepper on the pork chops before placing in the egg wash. Used Italian bread crumbs because I didn’t have any stuffing. Took exactly 20 minutes in a jelly roll pan and the chops were nice and crispy! Will make this again.
Once I used Italian seasoned breadcrumbs after coating the chops with flour, I loved it!
This recipe was easy to make. Instead of using milk and bread stuffing I used Italian breadcrumbs. The pork chops were delicious!!!

I was pleasantly surprised by this recipe. Definitely worth a shot. I followed some of the review suggestions. My chops were quite thick, so I left them in an extra 5 minutes (biting my nails) and they came out super moist and delicious. The breading isn't as crisp as I would like (because I have no spray oil maybe?) . But I will be trying this again and perhaps i'll give it a quick fry before baking for that extra crispiness.
Easiest way I've ever made chops and delicious also! Had to flip the chops a second time to bake 5 more minutes, but otherwise I followed the recipe. Mmm good! Anybody can make this recipe.
These turned out really tasty and tender!
I will make it again.

4 stars for the simplicity of it - nothing fancy but works for a quick meal. Season the chops with your favorite seasoning (Lawry's Seasoning Salt works) PRIOR to doing the egg bath and breading and that takes care of giving this dish some flavor.
Instead of butter I used olive oil and it worked just as fine. The pork needed about 12minutes on each side and it came so good.
I made this exactly as shown and it turned out great. Will definitely make again
Love this recipe made this recipe and came out perfect

I followed the recipe exactly and they were very good. The only problem I had was that the stuffing mix had a lot of large pieces in it. This made it difficult to stick to the egg mixture on the chops. Next time I will crush the stuffing mix before using.

These chops were simple to make, but were crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. The only change I made was to add a little seasoned salt before dipping in the egg. I also used italian bread crumbs because that's what I had on hand. 
 They were excellent, and my husband loved them.

I used Italian bread crumbs. I sprayed a foil covered baking sheet with cooking spray and sprayed the top of the chops too. So I skipped the butter. I have a convection oven so I reduced the heat 25 degrees and reduced the cook time. These were amazing. I’ve made these twice. So delicious! And not dry at all.

I've made this recipe twice and it came out great. I also learned a few things:

1 for way better flavor 1 use italian bread crumbs 

2 I only use thin chops

3 season the egg mixture - I added a little salt, garlic powder, paprika and black pepper

3 after dredging chops in egg mixture, toss them in a ziploc bag with the bread crumbs

4 for a crispier chop, use the most shallow pan like a cookie sheet with curve up edges. I found with a 1.5 or 2 inch pan the chops never crisp

5 I used half butter half olive oil

6 I ended up having to let chops cook a couple minutes longer to crisp - depends on the oven.

I hope this is helpful.

We thought the pork chops were delicious. This is one that I'll make again and again. I recommend thinner chops. I used thick chips and they took 50 minutes to cook. This made them a little dry. The taste is wonderful and the crust crunchy .I recommend that you use a rolling pin or food processor to get crumbs. I used my hands to break down the stuffing mix, and this way left a lot of big pieces.
Awesome recipe... Both husband and son loved it. Thanks!
I will make this dish again with a few changes. It taste a bit bland so I added a little bit of seasoning , and also used italian bread crumbs, Thank you for the recipe..

Wished could give this 10 stars. Awesome recipe & tastes like a gourmet meal. Followed the recipe exactly with only 2 minor additions, added garlic powder & season salt to the boxed pork stuffing mix. Served it with baked potatoes, peas & side of salad. Rachel THANK YOU for sharing it with us all. Also was wondering how would this work with boneless chicken breast?
Made this for my family and everyone loved them. No changes were made to the recipe. I followed it exactly as written. I plan on making them again! Thanks!
Excellent great for a cold Night cook everything in the oven and let it go. Also green bean casserole and cheesy potatoes. Yummy
Awesome, can't wait to try with Chicken

Only modifications I did were adding maybe 1/3 -1/2 cup of Planko bread crumbs. I had unseasoned stuffing mix (only thing store had) so I added a couple of table spoons of Italian seasoning. Other than that followed it 100% came out great. No leftovers great.
